CODIF_DATA.AA_AUTHORITY_TYPE: Ministry or any other national or federal authority
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C21

TITLE.P: Medical services - contracting family doctors (I)

SHORT_DESCR.P: The project "Everything for your heart - Screening program for identifying patients with cardiovascular risk factors" aims to reach 165,001 beneficiaries of the screening program, of which at least 50% belong to vulnerable groups, and 900 specialists involved in the screening to benefit from training programs, in order to ensure a high level of skills. In order to acomplish these activities, the contracting authority will contract family doctors to provide the following medical services: prevention, early detection (screening), diagnosis and early treatment for the main pathologies (cardiovascular diseases).
Total estimated value for medical services: 165.001 beneficiaries X 76,20 RON = 12.573.076,20 RON.
Total estimated value - lot 1 - West, South - West and South - East: 5.212.080 RON.

MAIN_SITE.P: at the contracted family doctors cabinets

SHORT_DESCR.P: The procurement's object is contracting family doctors from the 8 implementation regions, who intend to participate to the screening program in order to provide medical services - cardiovascular screening: prevention, early detection (screening), diagnosis and early treatment for the main pathologies (cardiovascular diseases) for an estimated number of 165.001 beneficiaries older than 40 years, including people belong to vulnerable groups.
the 8 implementation regions are divided into 3 lots:
Lot 1- West, South - West and South - East
This procurement is for LOT 1 - the regions: WEST, SOUTH - WEST AND SOUTH - EAST.

EU_PROGR_RELATED.P: Project title: "Everything for your heart - Screening program for identifying patients with cardiovascular risk factors" ; Financing contract: POCU/805/4/9/137424/ 27.07.2020; SMIS code: 137424/;

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: 1. The purpose of the procurement is to hire family doctors to provide cardiovascular services / cardiovascular screening for an estimated total of 165,001 beneficiaries over the age of 40, including persons belonging to vulnerable groups, who will benefit from support (screening) at national level in all 8 development regions,
2. The specific nature of the contract,
3. These medical services are part of the Social and other specific services set out in annex 2 of the Law 98/2016,

4. The minimum requirements set out in the award documentation, namely: Family doctors must have a contract with the National Health Insurance House and have, on their list, at least 185 people eligible for the target group of the screening program,

the prior publication of a contract notice or a notice of intent in the OJEU it doesn't bring any benefit for the contracting authority and it doesn't change the final result of the public procurement.
The contract notice was published on the website of the contracting authority, ensuring compliance with the legal provisions.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: National Council for the Resolution of Disputes

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: Details of the limit(s) for appeal proceedings:
Time limits for the exercise of the appeal are laid down in Article 8 of Law 101/2016.
